alert.note: Alert for Bottineau; McHenry (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 2:33PM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Bismarck ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Dakota... Willow Creek near Willow City affecting McHenry and Bottineau Counties. .Recent snowmelt has pushed Willow Creek near Willow City to near flood stage. The creek is expected to climb above flood stage tonight and crest under a half foot above flood stage Wednesday, and then fall slowly back below flood stage by Friday. Flood stage is 1442 feet. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Willow Creek near Willow City. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1441.2 feet, water begins backing up into ravines and gets to the top of the road by the gage. At 1442.7 feet, overflow occurs on the left bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 1441.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening, to 1442.4 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It is expected to fall below flood stage on Friday. - Flood stage is 1442.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1442.4 feet on 05/08/2013. &&
info.instruction: Water in the creek is very cold. Caution is urged if walking near the stream.
